review.title: Disappointed and  Dirty !!!!! Found new hotel
review.reviewText: We were scheduled to stay 2 nights but after checking in and seeing our room .... We couldn't imagine staying there for an hour ! So called Expedia to find us a better hotel which they did !!!! Bad news .. Looks like I can't get a refund from hotel or Expedia . Room was very cluttered and dusty baseboards / furniture . Beds were very small ....  the one bed was right up against the window which  was open with dead bugs on window sill like never wiped off.  The bed spread from 1970 s looks like never washed .. Found someone's hair on it !! Freaked out too because they made a copy of my credit card and license on check in ... I did request copy back when left right away .. Which  manager shredded infront of me . I hope it was the only copy made !!! Just felt odd .. My 15 yr son thought it was odd as well !!!!  Sooooooo VERY DiSAPPOINTED!!! If just looking for cheap place not too far to walk from the Wharf and don't care about cleanliness or clutter then it might work out !!  One positive .. The girl at the front desk was very pleasant and outside of building looks cute !!! Remember old saying ... Looks can be deceiving . Again I went in knowing this was going to be an odd set up with a shared bathroom in hallway facility but I do  EXPECT cleanliness !!!!!!

review.title: Authentic Hotel
review.reviewText: What an interesting and pleasing hotel. It was like staying at a huge bed and breakfast; other people staying there from all over the world were friendly and chatty. The room was very very small, which is why I said the room comfort was OK, but I guess I could have looked at the room size before booking it (have learned my lesson lol). By 10pm, the hotel was really quiet, and comfortable. You must share bathrooms with others, but every time I went to the bathroom, hardly anyone else was there.
review.positiveRemarks: Old San Fran feel, antiques, free books everywhere to grab and read, friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Just that the room sizes would be posted in a more obvious spot.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's war was about 4 blocks away, as well as pier 39. Cable cars, the ocean, right at your fingertips.

review.title: Nice Adult Hostel
review.reviewText: My daughter and I had planned a wonderful coastal drive from LA to San Francisco. we found San Remo on Expedia and we loved it!  Quaint and in a quiet neighborhood off the main streets, the hotel is a "throwback" to the early last century - all the furniture and fixtures from another time. As in hostel style, bathrooms are shared, so ask for a room with a sink. Great restaurant downstairs (though pricey) and within walking distance of major tourist stops. No elevator, no television, but that wasn't a problem. Lovely staff.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your very kind words, it is always a good feeling to know that you were happy with your stay and enjoyed our surroundings.
Sorry our detergent was not good for you. We do have 2 supermarkets very close by, where you can purchase every brand you might need. 
We will be delighted to see you back soon.

review.title: Perfect location to walk all over town.
review.reviewText: Perfect location for walking and much more affordable than at the piers.  Walked to the pier/restaurants - 4 blocks.  Walked to China Town - 12 blocks. Ghirardelli Square - 6 blocks.  Lombard Crooked Street 6 blocks. Spent just 3 days there and had so many wonderful experiences.  Never felt unsafe - there were a few places where homeless slept when we were walking around but they never once accosted us.  Lovely Italian restaurant downstairs, delicious Brazilian crepe restaurant nearby.  Very quiet and we were on the street side of the hotel.  Warm towels, nice shampoo, conditioner, soap, hand sanitizer, combs, mouthwash free for the taking.  Coffee, tea, apple cider, cocoa, licorice, tootsie rolls and mints during the day. Staff recommended good restaurants and short cuts to get there.
review.positiveRemarks: Charming antique furnishings.  Soft and hard pillow on each bed. Very quiet, perfectly located for walking or mass transportation - no rental car need
review.negativeRemarks: Can't use Tide - only laundry soap available in the laundry room. Would have liked a cup of tea at 11 but it is only available until 10 pm.
review.locationRemarks: Lombard Street, Buena Vista - best Irish Coffee, Pier 43 with famous seafood restaurants, Ghirardelli Square, the Cannery, Little Italy neighborhood.

review.title: Close to great parking, pier 39
review.reviewText: I  loved that it was so  close to Pier 39. If you don't mind walking, Chinatown was great. I worked up an appetite for awesome pork BBQ buns

review.title: A nice time machine...
review.reviewText:
This was a really cool old fashioned hotel - like what I imagine a 1940's boarding house was like.  But, it's not trying to be quaint - like some of the bed & breakfast I've stayed at.  You just get the sense that their perspective is that this is how it's worked for a century, so if it ain't broke... 

The rooms were very clean, but very small - so, between the room size and the shared bathroom facilities, it may not be great for a long stay.  But for a quick overnight, we loved it.
review.positiveRemarks: Old fashioned style, location, cleanliness, staff
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was pretty soft
review.locationRemarks: Quick walk to Pier 39

review.title: Great location, good price
review.reviewText: Very quant hotel with a lot of character. Amazing restaraunt right downstairs too!

review.title: Nice simple room close to waterfront and cable car
review.reviewText: Nice simple throw-back hotel reminiscent of older European hotels with basic rooms and communal showers and toilets on the same floor.  Each toilet and shower is in its own room so its private, not like a locker room. Great location right at the end of Mason Cable Car line. Close to waterfront and Coit Tower. Hotel sits on top of Italian restaurant, but not so noisy that you cant sleep just fine, especially after a day of sightseeing. No TV in my room, but didn't come to watch TV and great wifi lets you stream all you need on your computer or ipad. Atmosphere is turn of the century with antique furniture and art everywhere. Super easy to get to from SFO by BART and Cable Car.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable and perfectly located near Fisherman's Warf and waterfront activities.  So easy to get to from SFO by BART and Cable Car.
review.locationRemarks: End of Mason Cable Car line three short blocks from Fisherman's Warf.  But, on a lesser traveled street so no constant stream of tourist traffic.

review.title: Sweet and cute
review.reviewText: Charming with antiques and historical pictures everywhere.

review.title: Historical hotel with lots of character
review.reviewText:
This is my second stay here- and it was just as pleasant as the first time.  The staff are very accommodating, the rooms very quaint with so much character.   The bathrooms/showers are down the hall- but are very private and clean.  There are several located on both floors & you can use any of them.   I am a sound sleeper, but if you are not, there are ear plugs in your room.  You can hear people coming & going, doors opening & closing, showers, maids, people talking; although after about 11pm, it was very quiet.  The morning noise starts at about 7am it seems.  People that demand soundproof rooms- should not stay here; but you are missing out! 

Location, location, location!   Easy to get to many areas from the hotel - Fisherman's Wharf is just a few blocks away.  We enjoyed walking from North Beach to Chinatown- but there are plenty of options for public transportation, if you prefer. 

I went with a friend, and because the rooms were very affordable- we were able to each have our own room.  Some of the rooms have sinks in them, which is a nice addition.  We called the night before & they gave us rooms near each other. They have recently replaced all the beds- and they were very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: I absolutely love the uniqueness of the hotel- so much character.  The price is affordable- yet you have privacy, a clean room, wi-fi, coffee/tea.
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of anything that could be improved!
review.locationRemarks: Located in North Beach. There is a restaurant downstairs, Fior d’ Italia- America's oldest Italian restaurant!  The bar serves small plates- perfect!

review.title: We stayed in a two bed room.
review.reviewText: At first it was a bit noisy, from the kitchen downstairs.  But 9pm or so, all was so very quite.  Nice and calm.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location, ambience, love SF!
review.negativeRemarks: A common area where we could meet others and talk.  Share stories.  Coffee could be served a bit earlier, instead of 8 am.
review.locationRemarks: We visited the Wharf, did the tourist thing.  The next day, after staying at the hotel, we were up and out by 6:30 am to ride the Cable Cars.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for your words, we are happy that you enjoyed our historic property.

review.title: Hotel with historic vibe.
review.reviewText: Definitely exudes a historic vibe that it intended to. Love it.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with this hotel!  We liked the security door for starters, nice staff, VERY comfy bed, small bedroom but really what else do you need but a place to sleep?  Hot/cold drinks in the lobby, clean showers and bathrooms.  Made for a great place to stay during our visit to San Fran!
review.positiveRemarks: Security door, beds, drinks in the lobby, clean bathrooms/showers

review.positiveRemarks: Location

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your review. If you are a budget traveler and rather spend your money on experiences, the San Remo is your place. Save a bit here and go and use that money to have a wonderful time in San Francisco. 

Yes, our rooms are small, we do not hide this fact, but on the other hand, this is also a unique experience. Maybe you’ve never slept in a smaller room than “the original 1906 size room”.   

We hope to welcome you back again.

review.title: Great location, low price!
review.reviewText: My GF and I were a little leery of the shared bathroom concept, but it was the only place we could afford within walking distance (about 7 minutes) to the pier so we decided to give it a go.  We would absolutely stay there again. The things we didn't love were worth the location and price for us.  We had to lug our huge suitcases up 2 flights of stairs to get to our room, but assistance was offered to us to help.  The room was small, like so tiny we had to open our suitcase on the bed because there wasn't enough floor space, but this was acceptable because we were really only using the room to sleep in.  Our "window" opened to an indoor hallway right next to another guests "window" but at least it gave the impression of more air coming in.  The bathrooms, although shared, were clean and we never had to wait for the toilet or shower.  Softer towels would be nice, but that's really my biggest complaint.  If you're looking for luxury, this isn't your place, but if you want a clean bed to sleep in and a shower you don't mind sharing, the location couldn't be better!  We had Safeway & The Cable Car just around the corner too!  Super convenient!

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your review. We are sorry that you did not take the time to read the hotel description prior to making your reservation.

The San Remo Hotel was built in 1906 as a hotel and has continued operating since as a hotel. The Victorian architecture is reflected in our décor.
Thank you so much for staying with us.

review.reviewText: We should have checked before we booked this hotel.  There was no bathroom in the room.  It was like dorm.  There was no elevator or escalator.  Not so good when traveling with a handicapped 84 year old mom.  Also the parking was three blocks away.
review.positiveRemarks: It was like in the movies.
review.locationRemarks: The Fiore Restaurant below.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Charming hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice. Unlike any hotel I've been to before. It was rather charming. The shared bathrooms was something to get used to but I was able to adapt very easily. The facility was kept extremely clean and there was never any problems. The rooms were a little too cold for me so its important to bring extra blankets.

managementResponses.response:
We enjoy hearing from our guests.  We are glad that you found our staff to be friendly and helpful.

Our hotel has maintained its original layout and size, adapting to the modern traveler as much as we can, while keeping its historic charm and affordability.

You can always ask for help at the Front Desk, if you need help with your luggage. You are right about not traveling with a huge bad, the rooms are on the small side.

We look forward to our return when your travels bring you back to our beautiful city.

review.title: Quirky hotel with lots of character near the Wharf
review.reviewText: Warning: you will have to carry your luggage up at least one narrow flight of stairs upon arrival, just to get to reception, but don't let this put you off. You may also be put off by the small size of the rooms and by sharing bathrooms. The hotel quickly grew on my wife and me. It has an amazing character, we adjusted to the size of the room (do NOT come here with a lot of luggage, as there is no place to put it - your room will consist of a bed, a chair, a night table, and a small armoire with a few hangers), and the toilets and showers were great, no wait. The location is perfect - close to everything, yet very quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great, just a block from the cable cars. Rooms are quiet. Tons of character in this hotel. Staff was very friendly and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: Our beds were not very comfortable, especially for a couple. Rooms are small, built just for sleeping. If you want to read go elsewhere in the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: A block from the Powell/Mason cable car; minutes from Fisherman's Wharf. Easy access by bus to the Marina District or anywhere else in SF.

review.title: Great Hotel, very charming!

review.title: Simple, but unforgettable.
review.reviewText: Outside of hotel looked exactly in the picture. Everything else was cute and clean. The restrooms were always clean although they were outside of the rooms and in the hallways. We purchased the room with the working sink and it was definitely worth it, considering the fact that I was able to wash my face and brush my teeth in the comfort of my own room. The whole stay was a great experience and we will definitely be back to stay there again. I have already recommended this hotel to several people and they seem quite sold to staying at this hotel.

review.title: Quiet and quirky!
review.reviewText: Located in a fairly quiet area but very close to the cable cars and trolley buses, also very close to Fishermans Wharf and Pier39. Wasn't too sure about staying in a hotel with shared facilities but we had no problems at all, always very clean and plenty of fresh towels available. Staff were very helpful and polite and were always willing to help carry luggage up and down the stairs, would certainly recommend to the able traveller. Excellent breakfasts around the corner at Pat's Cafe too.

review.title: Loved the old Victorian character
review.reviewText: I would stay again at this place.  It does need some deep cleaning in the corners etc of the rooms and bathrooms, but overall good.  Staff friendly, and always warm towels at the showers and garbage regularly emptied.

review.title: Fun, European style hotel- close to everthing
review.reviewText: We loved the San Remo!  We could walk to all of the major tourist areas and the lovely Italian restaurant downstairs was a fabulous bonus.  The shared bath facilities are clean and accessible.  It was much like being at your grandma's house. We would stay again for sure!

review.title: Friendly and great location.
review.reviewText: If you want fancy, this is not your place, but the rooms are small and clean.  The staff is very friendly and the location is only a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf.  Built in 1906, it is a fun place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Uniqueness, Location and Price
review.locationRemarks: Only a couple blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and cable car line.

review.title: Great Wharf location. Walkable.
review.reviewText: Not sure if we liked sharing bathrooms. Cool and quirky. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Overall the place was great!
review.reviewText:
This hotel was a bit dated, but the staff was great and very pleasant.  Our room was small and the bed was a bit uncomfortable, however, they have a free massage chair that my wife and I used for a couple hours...It was very relaxing.

The staff was great and very kind.  We had shared bathrooms and showers.  We didn't read the fine print, otherwise, we may not have chosen this hotel.  It wasn't as bad as we expected, but still a downside to this place.

Would we choose this again?  Possibly.  It was very close to the Wharf, which was very important to us.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the massage chairs.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe take down the fake plants that are all over.  They just get dusty and it's hard to clean, therefore things just look dirty.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great, it was very close to the Wharf.

I did have a strong smell of urine when I get to the room.

review.title: Second stay in less then two months.
review.reviewText: For the cost and location there is no where I would rather stay. This time was enroute to a wedding and 7 family members stayed at the San Remo. Everyone was thrilled.
review.locationRemarks: As our group was coming and going it was lovely to have the happy hour at the bar downstairs as a meeting point. Terrific deal on drinks and food.

review.title: character hotel near Fisherman’s Wharf
review.reviewText: The San Remo hotel is located in a quiet neighbourhood close to the tourist spots of Fisherman's Wharf and Union Square. Our first impression was that the hotel was clean, welcoming, is loaded with character. We arrived late and they were very accommodating.  We booked an interior room with no sink which was very small (bed up against wall) and was quite warm at night. If you have the extra cash I would suggest booking a room with a sink and window - they were larger and would be more comfortable. The location of the hotel was great but we found ourselves venturing further out for nightlife etc. (Mission). This area of the city felt pretty safe and the street the hotel was on was quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: The charm of the hotel, quiet street, friendly staff, nice little amenities (coffee and snacks in the morning)
review.negativeRemarks: Our room was warm at night but there was efforts being made to try and cool (fans etc.)
review.locationRemarks: fisherman's wharf, union square, chinatown

review.title: Affordable and 1 block from the bus
review.reviewText: Great little find in North Beach, 1 block from the bus line that takes you right downtown.  Finding a decent hotel during a major conference can be very expensive but this was very affordable and was just a 10-15 minute ride to Moscone Center.  Very quiet neighborhood (except for the garbage truck at 5:00 am) and comfortable beds.  Would love a little desk space for a computer.
review.positiveRemarks: Funky character, history on the walls.
review.negativeRemarks: Need a small desk and chair for a computer.

photos.caption: Get a window and sink if you can.

review.title: As promised.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and Cable Cars

review.positiveRemarks: Nostalgia
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and Cable Cars

review.title: Quant European  style hotel in excellent location
review.reviewText: 17 years since my last stay and pleased that it just as I remembered it. This quant hotel is European style with tiny rooms, shared bathrooms and a walk up so keep that in mind and don't expect it to be the sterile corporate environment of chain hotels. It's history is everywhere from the decor to the art work. It's Victorian in nature. Staff is friendly and helpful.  With friendly traveller as its guests rather then uptight tourists. I highly recommend it. I'll be back!
review.positiveRemarks: Price, location, atmosphere, down stairs amazing Italian resturant and long bar.
review.negativeRemarks: Love that the wifi is free but connections could be a bit hit and miss. Perfect for keeping touch with those at home but I wouldn't plan on streaming
review.locationRemarks: We walked everywhere. SF is so easy to get around but plan your routes with hills in mind.

review.title: Great hotel, close to Wharf
review.reviewText: Staff was excellent. Sharing bathrooms is a non-issue...so don't let that deter you from booking at the San Remo!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was very clean, beds were comfy, the location is perfect, and there is a Trader Joe's right around the corner!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing. No complaints whatsoever.
review.locationRemarks: The location can't be beat. Close to good restaurants, Pier 39, Fishermans Wharf, cable cars and Alcatraz cruise boarding.

review.title: Cozy, comfortable, unique, close to bay
review.reviewText: Enjoyed staying in a hotel that was a little out of the ordinary. Room was beautiful, comfortable, and relaxing. Close to many attractions;  North Beach area, Lombard St., the wharves, beaches. I would definitely stay again if I was in San Francisco.

review.title: Great location, charming historic hotel!
review.reviewText: So close to Fisherman's Wharf and the Powell-Mason cable car this hotel was perfect for my 4 day stop in SF! My double bedroom with sink was clean and tidy, as were the shared bathrooms. The staff were friendly and I loved the historic charm of the hotel. It was on a quiet street, fairly safe by SF standards, had good security (I was a young, single female travelling alone) and was just half a block from food/pharmacies/entertainment etc. For the price i paid I was happy happy happy!

review.title: Great stay in sanfrancisco!
review.reviewText: Stayed in San Francisco for 4 nights at San Remo with my girlfriend whilst we travel! Thoroughly enjoyed our stay! Bathrooms were a worry as they're shared but they were very clean and there are plenty to go round! Really nice atmosphere in the hotel! Fantastic location! The touristy part is a three block walk down the street the civic centre and everywhere else is also in walking distance if you want to make a day of it! There is a tram stop that goes to the civic centre one block away if you don't fancy the walk anyway! Really enjoyed the stay and would recommend to all!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel. It feels like you have gone back in time. Great walking distance from Fisherman's Warf

review.title: Great little hotel, close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: My sister and I stayed here for four nights and really enjoyed it! The location is great, only two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and in walking distance to Lombard Street. The staff are really friendly and accommodating. It's clean, quiet and safe. As mentioned in other reviews, the rooms are a bit on the small side so it's a bit difficult with big luggage. The toilets and shower rooms are cleaned regularly and there wasn't a lot of waiting time. We didn't have a sink in the room which I think we'd ask for next time. They are now providing teas, coffees and water throughout the day which was great! We'd definitely stay again!
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great. The atmosphere is really nice for more mature travellers who like a clean, quiet, quirky place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: More storage facilities in the room for big luggage.

review.reviewText: We loved staying at San Remo! I would suggest it to anyone looking for a cozy hotel, with great staff, close to the wharf!

review.title: Good location with reasonable price
review.reviewText: Since we chose not an inside room, we expected outside room. But room we were assigned wasn't outside room either. It was a room with Window for air, but not facing outside, and was told that this is a room for a person booked with Expedia.  it was really disappointed, but reception staff was nice enough to upgrade our room

review.title: Great location and great value!
review.reviewText: Such a cute hotel in the perfect location in San Francisco! Walking distance to Lombard Street, Fisherman's Wharf, etc. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the staff is very attentive and helpful! Definitely would stay again and recommend to friends and family.

review.title: Just Like A Local!
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at The San Remo Hotel, and I will definitely return here every time I come to San Francisco! The San Remo Hotel has such a homey-feel to it, it is almost as if you are staying at home. The street that it resides on is residential, so you feel as if you are just part of the local scene here, but it is close enough to touristy things--such as Fisherman's Wharf-- so you can definitely feel as though you are on vacation.  For less touristy action, you are in walking distance from The North Beach neighborhood, where there is plenty of local culture, food, music, open space, history, architecture, etc., to make you feel as though you "belong to something".  The hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating, and I can't say enough about the cleanliness of the hotel (both the private room space and the restroom/shower areas)....everything is kept immaculate throughout the day and night.  A special thanks to the Housekeeping Staff on premises....they are wonderful! I loved my time spent at The San Remo.... I can't wait to return!!!! :-)  This place makes me love San Francisco even more! <3
review.positiveRemarks: I think that everything I have to say, I said it in the paragraph above! I Love The San Remo Hotel!!!! :-)
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I can think of at the moment....everything was great!
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything: the local library, churches, the water, wharves, docks, ferries, restaurants, parks, public transportation, stores, bike rentals.

review.title: No need for a car
review.reviewText: Had a great stay. Perfect location. Walk or take hop on, hop off bus where ever you want to go. Easy & inexpensive shuttle to/from airport. Would stay there again in a minute. Staff friendly & extremely helpful. Bathrooms down the hall no problem what so ever.
It was good... Near the warf... Old timey feel.  Much recommend.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Very quirky hotel but fits in well with north beach area. Rooms not equipped with en suite. Not enough shared bathrooms.
Very very helpfull staff. Excellent location.  Restraunt does not do breakfast but better cafe scene just up the road anyway.

review.title: Nice vintage hotel near Fisherman's Whaft
review.reviewText: Nice vintage and unique hotel within 10 mins walk to the Fisherman's Whaft.  Best to choose a room with a basin at last.  Shared bathroom and restroom availability is still descent.

We hope when your travels bring you to San Francisco you will stay with us again.

review.title: Great price , super cute hotel!
review.reviewText:
I was not expecting much since the price was so low for the area .. But was pleasantly surprised !
The room was clean , as well as the communal bathrooms .. I never really had to wait for a shower or stall . 
They have massage chairs on each floor and coffee /tea/water when the front desk is open.
The staff was all very friendly ! 
The only cons about the place was that since the rooms are so crammed in there is was a bit noisy at times ( which they probably know since earplugs were provided in the room lol) and the room was stuffy.. Even with a fan going it felt like a sauna every time we got back to the room.. But I'm assuming it might have to do with the amazingly nice weather they were having as well . 
Overall I would definelty recommend this hotel 
Oh and one of the highlights of our trip was having drinks at the bar downstairs .. The bartenders there are awesome company .. And the tiramisu martinis are addicting !!

review.title: Pleasant -- but no elevator
review.reviewText: A good price for a room at this location -- an easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf, to several of the cable car lines, and to the very convenient F-Market street car.  The hotel is over Restaurant Fior;  a meal here is excellent Italian fare -- friendly staff.  Be warned, however -- the hotel is a one-flight walk-up from the street;  and many rooms are an additional flight (or two) up from there -- there is no elevator.  Some of the small rooms have no outside access -- no windows for fresh air -- and, with no air conditioning (though with ceiling fans), the rooms can get quite warm.  Excellent connections with Lorrie's Shuttle from the hotel to the San Francisco Airport for about $14.00 per person;  be sure to make your reservation at the hotel front desk at least a day in advance of your trip.  (Lorrie's will also pick you up at the airport and bring you directly to the hotel.)  Most of the front desk staff are friendly and helpful, though an occasional bad temper seems to slip through.  For extra money, ask about the pent-house -- you must phone.
review.positiveRemarks: Location!
review.negativeRemarks: Add elevator.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: Off the beaten path
review.reviewText: Great little hotel to stay at if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle. Cozy atmosphere with friendly staff. Rooms and facilities are kept up and coffee was ready in the morning. Exceptional value for the price.

review.title: Old and Funky in North Beach
review.reviewText:
Staying at the San Remo, I felt like I was back in my old hostelling days.  Tiny rooms, shared facilities, and a general communal feel give this hotel charm like few others.  The rooms are tiny and only some have sinks, so be sure to reserve a room with a sink if you have that particular need.  The San Remo isn't luxurious, but what it lacks in modern amenities it makes up for with a general sense of old fashioned living.  

If you're looking for a place to stay in bed and watch The Discovery Channel, try the Travelodge down the street.  If you want to have a real experience, the San Remo is a great jumping off point.  Fisherman's Wharf is about a five minute walk.  The surrounding area is full of restaurants and bars to suit any taste or price point.  For those who want to go a bit farther astride, downtown is about thirty minutes away on foot, but it'll take you hours because of all of the things to see and do on Columbus street, the main drag leading directly to the TransAmerica Pyramid.

In a nutshell, the San Remo is a throwback to Victorian living that offers no modern distractions (save for a washer and dryer onsite).  After your long day roaming the streets of Chinatown, grab a good book and a bottle of wine and chill out if your simple, quiet room at the San Remo.
review.positiveRemarks: Cozy, experience-oriented, close to many tourist activities.  Lombard, Fisherman's Wharf, the Embarcadero, a cable car - all within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in parking was a trick to figure out.  They key system might be modernized.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard, restaurants and bars, shopping, cable car, buses, parking, grocery stores, bike rentals...

review.title: Nice and quaint  hotel, walking  possible
review.reviewText:
Italian Charm .
In central  location  and makes walking around  San Francisco  easy.

review.title: One Night Before our Cruise with Princess
review.reviewText: I thought it would be fun to stay at San Remo as it looked funky.  It was.  I loved it.  It is a quaint, old hotel, that has a very unique style. Similar to staying in a University during the summer months. I was with my 15 year old daughter, we felt safe.  Before 9 pm it was quite rowdy outside our window on the street, but it all quieted down by 11 pm. The room was small, we shared a double bed. It was clean. We ate at the restaurant at the Hotel, it was quite fancy. We had Wifi, in our room, so we watched netflix on our Iphones. They offer free coffee, hot chocolate, tea or hot water. They will carry your luggage upstairs if you need help, as there is no elevator.
review.positiveRemarks: If you like historic old world charm, in a community style type living arrangement - then you will love San Remo.
review.negativeRemarks: Having popcorn available, for your room
review.locationRemarks: Very close to local attractions, we walked every where. steps from Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Nice clean hotel about 10 minute walk to pier
review.reviewText: Small room, but very clean.  Extremely helpful staff.  Nice decor ~ you could spend several hours checking out the antiques.  I will stay again....

managementResponses.response:
We are in a wonderful location for the City Buses or Big Bus as well as for walking to many attractions.

We know we are a different kind of Hotel, our bathroom layout is very common in Europe, but somewhat unusual for the USA.

Thank you for your suggestion, we always try to incorporate them if possible.

Hope to see you soon again.

review.title: Good location for seeing the city
review.reviewText:
The hotel was located well for both walking to the city sites and getting down to the location to catch the Big Bus for their 20 available site seeing stops to get done in two days.
Common bath room was a new experience.  I'm glad my room had a sink so I could brush my teeth in privacy.  
I would suggest the staff have the coffee available a bit earlier in the morning.

managementResponses.response:
We appreciate your comments about our hotel. All of us are here to provide the best experience possible for our guests, while keeping our hotel historic and authentic.

You are right, our rooms are on the smallish side, so we don't recommend bringing the "steamer trunk". We are glad that you enjoyed our massage chairs.

Thank you again, and we look forward to serving you in the future.

review.title: Perfect location, and so much charm!
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the San Remo for 6 nights. The hotel is right in North Beach, with a 7 minute walk to Fisherman's Pier. We were able to get in the Hop On, Hop Off bus right at the end of the street. The hotel is absolutely fascinating, with all it's little nooks and crannies, and there's a lot to explore within the hotel. The hotel had a lot of small features that really made our stay feel like a treat, like the heated shower stalls and towel warmers, the generous tea selection by the front desk, the boxes of raisins left in our room, and the massage chair and book selection in the window nook. 

The rooms and hallways are tiny, so for that reason I wouldn't recommend the hotel to anyone travelling with children or a lot of luggage. I never found the communal bathrooms to be a problem. They were always impeccably clean and since there are so many spread out among the rooms there's never a need to wait. 

I would absolutely recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a unique experience beyond the typical chain hotel, and who appreciates a little history with their stay.

managementResponses.response:
We appreciate you taking time to review the San Remo Hotel.

The San Remo Hotel was built in 1906. The hotel is decorated with very special artwork and furnishings. We love maintaining the look of the Victorian period, while trying to bring in modern necessities such as our complimentary Internet and free WI-FI.

Thank you for staying with us.

review.title: Nice old hotel!!
review.reviewText: Just an easy walk to fishermans wharf.  Trader Joes next block over for snacks.

review.title: Charming!
review.reviewText: Like a big, warm San Francisco hug!  Quaint and charming with a courteous, young and friendly staff.  The San Remo gives you a feel for old San Francisco, yet it is only a few blocks from the hub of Fisherman's Wharf and all that is new!  100% recommended.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything!

review.title: Charming old hotel small rooms, big hearts
review.reviewText:
In a nutshell: If you can embrace the smaller rooms the potential noise and the community feel of this beautiful hotel you will love your stay.

This hotel has style. It's like stepping back in time to the roaring 20's. Because the building was created in the age before sound insulation was a common practice in buildings you can hear noises from out on the street or the restaurant below the hotel rooms. Also the rooms have ceiling fans and windows but they do not have A/C. 

I am fortunate enough to be a deep sleeper and enjoyed the festive atmosphere and enjoyed my stay. (It should be noted that they do supply ear plugs btw) 

The staff are very professional and the bathrooms and showers were very clean I made a point to check on this regularly. I would like to note that although the staff is extraordinary at the upkeep the showers and sink/bathrooms are a community space and sometimes careless or messy guests can ruin the experience for everyone on your floor.   

Lets be frank about this hotel the rooms are very small (APPROX) 20 by 20 rooms. Often the room will be furnished with a wardrobe or dresser to hold your clothing. The sizes of room are good for singles or couples not big families.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the style of the hotel, the awesome staff and being in the heart of everything. We were able to walk to all the big tourist locations.
review.negativeRemarks: I wouldn't change a thing. I loved it all.

Fishermans wharf
Pier 39

Rogue Brewerie etc.

review.title: Fair comment
review.reviewText: Room was very cramped for us because we are on a long trip with two big cases and I think the room we got was one of the smallest.  Guests need to be aware that "bathrooms" are actually only shower rooms.  There is nowhere else private to wash unless you book a room with basin.  The hotel is in a quiet location (or we found it so) but it's down to the other residents' considerateness as to whether you get any sleep or not - I didn't!  We had very noisy neighbours who spent the whole of one night packing and unpacking, thumping cases about and talking loudly and were kept awake the first night by general comings and goings.  Bed was comfortable. Would think rooms by toilets and shower rooms would be very noisy, due to fans going all night.  Management should put signs up asking residents to turn the lights (and their accompanying fans) off after using the loo or shower - apart from anything else it's very wasteful.  Still, good value for its location at S.F. prices.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, location, restaurant downstairs, thought this was closed by the time we checked in at 9.30 p.m.
review.negativeRemarks: A couple of comfortable chairs in the hallway would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: Biking over the Golden Gate Bridge on a tandem was a really great experience and Marin is beautiful.  Alcatraz was very interesting - wrap up warm!

review.title: If you love clean funk -- it is the place
review.reviewText: Really love the pesionne European style. If you looking to the Hilton - this ain't it. If you are looking for cool, low cost lodging with a cutting Ashe of the 60's - this is your place.

review.title: Deal in San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Can't beat the location and the rate. Tiny room, shared bathrooms. If you are not coming to San Fran to sleep, it's an excellent choice!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Just a little noisey at night with restaurant nearby but otherwise wonderful place to stay.

review.title: SAN Remo Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and many of San Francisco's attractions.  It was also close to a few choice restaurants.  Hotel staff very friendly and helpfull.   My wife and I were a little leery at first sharing a washroom/shower/bathroom, but after the first night, we became accustomed to it.  Bathrooms were very clean, as was the hotel.  This hotel was approximately 100 years old, and is a wonderful piece of San Francisco history.  I would recommend it to friends, and anyone visiting San Francisco.  Affordable, clean and Historical!

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf but walls are paper thin
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean but the mattress was covered with plastic and made noise every time you moved. Walls are thin and you can hear your neighbors. Resteraunt under hotel has very unfriendly bar tenders especially on New Years eve.

review.title: Nice hotel if you know what you are getting
review.reviewText: The hotel room is small and close to neighbors/thin walls; the bathrooms are also shared. If you know this then the hotel is a great experience. Great location, 5-10 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Hotel has parking deal with nearby shopping center and decent priced. Also the staff and maids are very helpful and nice. There was a night deskman that stayed up and let us in the hotel when we came after midnight. Also when I was waiting for a shower, the maids pointed out another shower that had freed up - since showers were in multiple locations. Overall I would come back since we got a good price for New Year's weekend.
review.positiveRemarks: The nostalgic old building and the somewhat college-border feel and environment. Also staff very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe allow people to pay extra if they want an unshared bathroom. Though it wasn't too bad to share.
review.locationRemarks: Right near Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: great hotel for the price

review.locationRemarks: location very convenient for me

review.title: Great European experience
review.reviewText: Stayed above our favorite Italian restaurant, Fior D'Italia.  Felt like we were staying in Italy and the shapes of the rooms and the hallways and the window situations were really your unique.  Didn't find the shared bathrooms a problem at all.

These are old prewar boarding rooms. Most rooms slant down including stairwell to upstairs. Junk everywhere . There are better hotels in area.
