managementResponses.response:
We are considered by some to be one of San Francisco’s best kept secret, according to some of our guests and travel writers.

We will let Ariel know that her efforts are appreciated. We are delighted that there were so many things that you appreciated about the San Remo Hotel.

We look forward to having you visit us again.

Our goal is to keep the prices affordable and be a different experience, a place you will remember for years to come.

review.title: Lovely Euro-style Hotel
review.reviewText: This place exceeded my expectations! I was nervous about our reservation, our chief concern was the shared bathroom, but it turned out to be a lovely stay. At check in, the front desk woman, Ariel, took one look at my traveling companion (who is well over 6 feet tall) and told us that she would find us a room without a foot-board which he greatly appreciated. The bathroom at the end of our hall had a gorgeous tub, towels were kept on towel warmers just outside the bathrooms, and there were a myriad of other cute and quirky items provided for our stay including pillow mints, tiny boxes of raisins, earplugs, etc. Very thoughtfully put together and run.
review.locationRemarks: Only a few blocks from Fisherman's wharf/Pier 39/Alcatraz landing and there is a Trader Joe's nearby and a Safeway.

review.title: One of the nicest hotels!
review.reviewText: Full of character & history. We'll have to return one day so as to spend more time reading all about it & looking at all the historic pictures. Small rooms, be so what? A lovely place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: History
review.locationRemarks: Very close to pier 39

review.title: Friendly, atmospheric hotel from another era
review.reviewText: arrived at the San Remo on Wednesday night to a 4 piece jazz quartet in the restaurant downstairs. Friendly, helpful reception helped me plan the day in San Francisco on the bus and streetcar.  I felt right at home.
review.positiveRemarks: pretty atmosphere
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: great location near fishermans wharf

review.title: Nice hotel, very close to all the action.
review.reviewText: Walking distance to most attractions - easy access to breakfast and dinner places. The room was quite small but absolutley fine for me on my own as a place to sleep. The bed was really comfortable, but the room might have been a bit small if there were 2 of us with big bags. There was a little early morning noise outside, but I was waking up early anyway. No problem for me to have the toilet and bathroom down the hall. The shower was a little bit difficult to use without getting your clothes wet. Really enjoyed my dinner at the Italian restaurant below, and loved the whole atmosphere of the hotel. Staff were lovely and friendly and eager to help. Would definitely recommend it as a place to stay for a short stay in San Fran.
The stay in this hotel took me to another place.  It felt so homey and warm.  I will definitely be back!

The hotel and hotel room were not what I am accustomed to. There were no tv's, no A/C,  and a community bathroom and community shower on each floor. The room was very hot so I was forced to leave the window open all night. It was very loud outside and there were no window screens on the windows. I might as well slept on the wood floor because the mattress was outdated and not comfortable. I am not one to complain but I would not recommend this hotel to friends of mine. Sorry.

review.title: Really neat experience!
review.reviewText:
It was so neat to be in such an well kept old fashioned hotel and get a feel of what it was like "back in the day", early as 1904. Definitely not wheelchair accessible or for anyone who cannot tolerate the stairs, narrow hallways, and sharing bathrooms, but really a fun experience and great location if up for a different flair!
Receptionist took a long time getting me a room...30 minutes even though I had booked on line.  To date, I have not received my receipt even though I requested it on a postcard. No one there before 8 am to give you a print out receipt.
review.positiveRemarks: Well kept, very relaxing, and unique experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Receptionist services and more effective way to get a receipt.
review.locationRemarks: I only went because I was too tired to drive home to Santa Rosa after work...so I was able to go to Safeway, Walgreens, and Rossx

review.title: Great location, comfortable, freindly
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in San Fran. The staff were very helpfull and helped us with transport information.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf, clean and very comfortzble
review.negativeRemarks: No
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants and cafe's near by. Close to transport and the cable cars.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Near Fisherman's wharf and China town.  Comfortable bedroom.  Clean hotel.  Essential amenities available.

review.title: Great location near Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: Very cute hotel!  Loved the old style charm. Great location near the wharf.  Lesson learned - San Fran really is full of hills, don't try to walk from the Union Square BART station to the hotel (we did it, but not at all an easy walk).  Wharf and Pier 39 are right nearby.  Hotel staff were great when we arrived later than expected, getting in just past the front desk closing time.  Stayed over Halloween and loved that the staff decorated the place for the occasion.  Free coffee/hot chocolate/tea was a nice touch in the lobby.    Shared showers were not an issue at all, although we stayed during the start of the slow season. Never-ending hot water for them and good shower heads were fantastic after long days of sightseeing.    Room we had was fairly small, but didn't really need more space.  Boyfriend found the bed a little too short (he's about 5'10 and found his feet would hang off the end if trying to lay straight).  Overall though very much enjoyed our stay and would recommend if you want to stay somewhere with character instead of your average chain hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Very charming. We stayed over Halloween and came back in the evening to find Halloween treats left by the staff - a very fun surprise!
review.negativeRemarks: Ask not to be by the bathrooms - walls too thin.  Also morning cleaning staff were very loud in the hall outside our room between 6-7am.
review.locationRemarks: A quick walk away from Fisherman's Wharf - lots of food/activities nearby, easy to catch the F train to head to farther piers.

review.title: Close to everything location
review.reviewText: My experience at the hotel was great. I felt right at home. Expedia over charged me like $27 a night so I will call hotels direct next time.

review.title: Tired of the same old came old?
review.reviewText: Then try this one.  Yes, it is an old place, built in 1906 but upgraded and very clean, very well kept.  No elevators, carpeted floors, immaculate common bathroom and shower, and toilet facilities.  Rooms was small, but I didn't go there to spend the day in a hotel room.  4 Blocks from Fisherman's Wharf cable cars and all the rest of the old city charm was well worth while. Great restaurant neighboring the hotel.  The fan on the ceiling kept the room comfortable, the clothes armoire was sufficient for what I had to place in it.  If you want a sanitized carbon-copy boring room with all the electronic wizardry available in the chain hotels by the uncountable thousands, then this probably isn't the place for you.  If you want a place to spend the night, clean up, and use as a base for exploration, and want to indulge the adventurous spirit still in you, then by all means go for this one. AND, the price was great for the location.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, great price for the location, friendly staff, rustic/historical setting, good restaurant downstairs in the adjacent building
review.negativeRemarks: I can't see that happening.  Not the place to go to if you need a wheel chair or elevator to get up and down.
review.locationRemarks: on Mason, 4 blocks from Boudin's Bakery and the sea-food restaurants at the western end of the Wharf.  Also 4 blocks or so from public transit (MUNI),

review.reviewText: Very close to fishermans wharf, Chinatown & Coit tower.

review.title: Good place to stay!
review.reviewText: Good Location we were able to walk every where we wanted to go.
review.positiveRemarks: IT was cozy and fun to look at all the memorabilia. Beautiful building.
review.negativeRemarks: I thought the bed was really really hard.
review.locationRemarks: I am an espresso drinker, Starbucks is right around  the corner. The Warf is super close. You can walk to everything you want.

review.title: Wonderful location
review.reviewText: Just fantastic having the Italian restaurant below.  It has wonderful staff and a enjoyable bar.  The hotel is very cool, even though you share the bathrooms, the heated towels and clean showers makes for a nice stay.

review.title: Old style, but definitely different
review.reviewText:
A great location to wander around 
fishermans warf, china town, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Old style, quaintness
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing if wanted to retain /"old charm"
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant location

review.title: Ok hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed 2 nights and it worked fine if you didn't want any downtime in the room. Super small, no TV and the internet didn't work in our room.  Would of preferred my own bath but it was fine. Not good for children.  Could stay again but probably won't. Staff awesome and helpful.

review.title: Luck of the draw
review.reviewText:
After booking San Remo because of the Expedia recommendations, I was very disappointed with my first room (I booked twice - before and after a trip). It was so small that I could not open my case on the floor, and the bed was so high that I had difficulty lifting my suitcase onto it. The shower opened directly onto the hallway, so it was difficult to get dressed in the shower without getting clothes wet. I saw a number of people walking from the shower in their underwear because of this. Bathroom facilities are really more hostel than hotel.

However, on returning from my trip, I stayed in a room with its own hand basin (more expensive), but it was much roomier and more comfortable than the first. 

While I was not happy with the facilities, the staff were very helpful and stored my suitcase while I was on my trip, and after I checked out until time to go to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were helpful. Access to the internet and wifi available. Best of all was the massage chair which I discovered on the last day.
review.negativeRemarks: toileteries (shampoo and conditioner) in room.  Tea and coffee facilities for late arrivals.
review.locationRemarks: Close to cable car and Fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Quaint, old hotel very close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Had a great two night stay, very original, very quaint old style hotel. Rooms quite small and shared bathroom but for the originality in San Francisco and so close to Fisherman's Wharf it was great. Preferable to a large inpersonal hotel.

review.title: Full of character, great location.
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed staying at this historic hotel. Be prepared that it's old, so some amenities aren't there such as lifts, and bathrooms are shared, but it's in a great location near fisherman's wharf, Chinatown, downtown and trams. 

The staff are friendly and the place is well serviced, and overall I'd recommend as a reasonably priced option given other accommodation in such a good location.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: For two nights' stay close to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and Chinatown, the San Remo was a perfect choice for our family of 3.  Shuttle service to and from the airport worked flawlessly.  The hotel was very close to both a trader Joe's supermarket as well as a Safeway with a great deli.  In the hotel, going down the hallway to shower or use the toilet took a little adjustment, but the accommodations were adequate and certainly less expensive than name brand hotels in the area.  Would we stay at the San Remo again?  Yes, absolutely yes!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and price were the most positive features.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.

review.title: Rooms were too small and not sound proof.
review.reviewText: Got in late, and tired room was so tiny and near the reception. No room to move and not very private.
review.positiveRemarks: It had character and was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Door locks working
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Staying in the Past
review.reviewText: Takes you back in time..loved the old world charm, clean, friendly staff, great location. If your light sleeper it may not be the right place for you. We will definitely be back.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your review. We are not a modern Hotel, in fact we take great pride in maintaining the wonderful old world charm of this 1906 Hotel to create an authentic historic experience.

We regret to hear you were not comfortable. We have very few days that the heat is unbearable, usually the natural "air conditioning" of the Bay kicks in and the breeze cools down the temperature. There are very few buildings dating from 1906 in San Francisco that have air conditioning.

We are fairly close to the Bay and we do get a very refreshing ocean breeze. Some days you may hear the sea lions barking on Fisherman’s Wharf, we are just a short stroll away from the hotel.

review.title: Showing its age.
review.reviewText: very small cramped rooms, the pictures on-line are very deceiving, my wife and I found the bed uncomfortable and the heat unbearable.
review.positiveRemarks: near to fishermans warf.
review.negativeRemarks: everything except the service.
review.locationRemarks: all the attractions were nearby, trolly cars, the warf etc.

review.title: Great location. Tiny room
review.reviewText: This hotel has a fantastic location but the rooms are extremely small with no room to put a suitcase down and the beds squeek with every move.

review.title: San Remo August 2014
review.reviewText: Overall experience was OK.  This hotel is not for anyone that needs a wheel chair.  No elevators.  Toilets and showers are small.  Reception is one flight of stairs up from street level.  Rooms are small and cramped.  There is a restaurant on the first floor.  My room (#30) was right above the kitchen, so it was very noisy until 11:00 PM.  Monday, Wednesday, and Friday is trash pickup, so expect to be awakened at 5:30 AM by the garbage truck in the alley outside (crashing bottles and dumping of many trash bins).  Now for the good news... Hotel location could not be better. Close to everything.  Hotel staff are great.  Housekeeping does a great job.  Rooms are not air conditioned.  Be sure to get a room that has a window to the outside.  Interior rooms have windows to the hallways for air circulation.  Security is good.  No phones, TV's, or refrigerators in rooms.  Think of it as a college dorm.

review.title: Excellent Stay at the San Remo
review.reviewText:
Excellent Hotel in the perfect location. The staff at the San Remo Hotel went above and beyond!!!
I felt like I was at home there and I overheard many more quest saying the same thing. The hotel atmosphere is like stepping back in time. I will stay there again!!!!!!

review.title: We enjoyed the classic San Francisco architecture!
review.reviewText:
We had a great time here. The hotel is very well looked after. Like any hotel that is over a century old in a place like San Fran, it's got some interesting idiosyncrasies. The only of these I cared about was that there is a fair bit of street noise outside and if you don't take precautions (the hotel considerately provides ear plugs!), you're likely to be up with this irritating garbage truck that rolls by sometime after 5am.

It is NOT one of those cookie-cutter places with corporate decor and highly predictable (monotonous, soulless... choose your adjective) characteristics. It's really different from any hotel we've stayed at before, and that is a GOOD thing. We left home to come to San Francisco to experience something new, after all, and we appreciated that this little place provided it and made it fun. Its location is practically unbeatable. It has shared bathrooms, which are really nicely looked after and accessible, so don't be surprised by such things. We didn't find this a problem at all. 

We would stay there again. We really liked it, and the staff were uniformly helpful and cheerful with us. I guess it's probably not for anyone who just really needs a hotel that is deadly quiet and really spacious. It's for people with a taste for San Francisco and the novelty that city can bring. We liked it a lot, with only minor reservations.

review.title: Unique experience
review.reviewText:
Very unique experience staying here, didn't mind sharing the showers/washrooms at all. Room was a bit small but manageable, bed itself was comfortable but very noisy. Loved the decorations and the layout of the hotel.
Very convenient for walking down to Fisherman's Warf and access to transportation. Will definitely stay at again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, decorations as well as the historical background

review.title: No elevator to help with luggage.
review.reviewText:
It was a quaint place but I can't stay there again.  Urine on the water closet floors.
No drinking water available after staff left.
review.positiveRemarks: The area and the Fior d' Italia
review.negativeRemarks: What I mentioned above.

review.title: Quaint, romantic Historical nostalgia.
review.reviewText:
Staying at the San Remo is an experience worth trying. With all the charm of old San Francisco this Hotel is like stepping back in time. Reading through the history of its original inhabitants gives you the flavor of a time gone by.
It was lovely to eat at the Italian restaurant down stairs, the food and experience was the best I have experienced yet world wide. If only I could dine there every night!
Staff were friendly and very helpful with directions and information, going out of their way to make sure you had all that you needed to make your journey away the smoothest it could be.
I would love to come back some time soon, the fact that this hotel is situated in a safe and quiet neighborhood was comforting and great for my first time experience in San Francisco. Close to everything you come to experience, I can't wait to return!
review.positiveRemarks: Charm, old style character, the bath and the friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: I can not think of anything I would improve.
review.locationRemarks: The bay is near by and the city bay cars, lovely restaurants, little Italy, Fisherman's wharf, Alcatraz, the Golden Gate bridge and so much more.

review.title: Great for a short and affordable stay
review.reviewText:
We stayed for four nights and the first two were alright. The last two were less so as there is no sound proofing and there were other guests up very late making a considerable amount of noise. I don't blame the hotel for the noise, but the potential for a restless night is something to keep in mind.
The building is over 100 years old and is maintained well for it's age. Overall it is kept pretty clean, my only complaint being the shared showers, which though I'm sure are wiped down daily do not seem as though the tile is scrubbed regularly.
We didn't hate our time there, but we were happy to be going home after the fourth night. We would stay again if it was just for one night or two, but anything longer and we'll be finding a different venue.

review.title: Great location and pretty cute
review.reviewText: It's a cosy and cute place in a great location. I didn't miss not having a TV in the room, but the wifi was pretty spotty. That's my only negative thing to say about it, and when I complained, they seemed serious about looking into the issue, so it may not be a valid complaint for much longer. Simple rooms, clean and bright. Comfy pillows. An excellent value.
review.locationRemarks: Steps away from Fisherman's Wharf and about a 15 minute walk to Chinatown (though it's up a heck of big hill).

review.title: good budget hotel
review.reviewText:
good budget hotel/hostel. clean, the cleaners are funny and nice. staff are lovely.
its VERY quiet and you can hear everything. rooms are tiny. but considering price its a good stay.
review.positiveRemarks: location is good too.
review.negativeRemarks: bigger rooms, newer beds.

review.title: A trip to a simpler time
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the San Reno and would love to come back again. Its such a neat, quaint hotel from the Victorian era in a nice quiet area very close to Fisherman's Wharf and the cable cars. Very warm and cosy.
review.positiveRemarks: (above statement)
review.negativeRemarks: an elevator to help seniors with their heavy bags or a staff member for that purpose. or put seniors on the main floor.
review.locationRemarks: (stated above)

review.title: Amazing!
review.reviewText: This was an amazing experience, the hotel was so cute and charming. I felt safe and comfortable. The location is perfect, everything is within walking distance and the best part was the convince of having Trader Joe's a block down.
review.positiveRemarks: It's hard to decide, when the staff was nice, the location was perfect and the atmosphere was lovely.
review.negativeRemarks: Ummm....

review.title: Good budget choice-no frills
review.reviewText: Good budget option-like hostel but private room. Simple room, no tv, but wifi. Very sweet charming setting inside. Shared bathrooms but very clean, hot shower, heat lamp. Quiet night. Very close to fishermans wharf, restaurants, trader joes, costco. Parking 2 blocks down and reasonable compared to big budget hotels.

review.title: Beautiful, Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very neat! The staff was fantastic, and were very helpful and accommodating. There is very little street parking (it is San Francisco after all), but you can park and unload your car in front of the hotel, and the staff can give you directions to a nearby parking garage. Our stay was very nice, and I would recommend staying in this hotel.

review.title: Feels like home
review.reviewText: Perfect for a traverler in solo like me ! The place is charming, the staff is friendly as professionnal abd the location is perfect ! Love it!

review.title: Excellent location near many attractions.
review.reviewText: Hotel has European feel and was an attraction in itself. Near Little Italy ( restaurants, nightlife), Fisherman's Wharf, and a short walk to Chinatown. Shared bathrooms (showers & toilets separate) were not a problem, but part of the experience. There are several on each floor & I never had to wait. However, do get a room with a sink. Loved the complementary massage chairs on each floor (3rd floor is better one though). I read other rewiews that said the place could be noisy, but that was not my experience. Very pleased with my 3 night stay there.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, character, friendly staff...(see above)
review.negativeRemarks: Whatever they use to clean/ sanitize the toilets/ showers to me had a slightly sour smell...not really a problem, just a suggestion for improvement.
review.locationRemarks: Near Little Italy ( restaurants, nightlife), Fisherman's Wharf, and a short walk to Chinatown.

review.title: Nice old hotel near the wharf.
review.reviewText: Wonderful old hotel near the wharf. Really enjoyed the architecture of the building. Perfect little place in a great city.

review.title: European style pension
review.reviewText: The San Remo is an excellent choice for those seeking something a bit different in lodging. The hotel has a marvelous history and is absolutely charming! It's nestled between Fisherman's Wharf and North Beach - the location can't be beat! The rates are great and the staff was cordial and helpful for the most part. Be aware it can get noisy, though, as it sits atop a popular Italian restaurant. However, I found that after 11pm everything quieted down. The maids do a wonderful job of keeping the communal bathrooms, showers and sink areas clean. I was very happy with my stay at the San Remo!
review.positiveRemarks: I liked it's character and charm and historic significance.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: The cable car turn-around is a block away! Fisherman's Wharf is an easy walk, as is the bus stop heading to Chinatown.

review.title: Nice central hotel.
review.reviewText: The staff were all very helpful. Was quite dubious about sharing shower facilities but in actual fact it worked out very well. Any shower on both floors could be used and the dressing rooms were lovely.
review.positiveRemarks: Owners have tried to maintain it in a period fashion.
review.locationRemarks: The location was brilliant. Only 8 minutes walk to Fisherman's Wharf and the beach. Many restaurants nearby.

review.title: Old world charm.
review.reviewText: I found the hotel quaint and fun. I was a bit concerned about sharing a bathroom with strangers but they were kept amazingly clean and I found it all kind of fun. One morning my sister brought me a latte from Starbucks but i couldn't drink it because dairy is not my friend. On my way out, a handsome man was standing waiting for the shower and I offered it to him. He was delighted to accept! The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. My only issue with the room was that the mattresses and pillows were rather hard. They didn't keep me from sleeping, though, and the earplugs were a thoughtful touch. I give it heads up for sure but if you have any physical issues be aware there are steep flights of stairs and no elevator - after all it was built in 1906...I would stay there again in a heart beat.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, rates, ambiance.
review.negativeRemarks: Better mattresses and pillows.
review.locationRemarks: I easily walked to Ghiradelli Square and the waterfront. Loved Water Street and the beautiful plants and trees lining it. Pat's Cafe is excellent.

review.title: Good location, helpful staff.
review.reviewText: Very cramped rooms and many have windows into the hall. Top floor is much lighter than second floor. Ask for outside window if you want to see out. Bathrooms are good, clean and people tend to share well and try to leave them without mess.

review.title: Close to all the major attractions in San Fran
review.reviewText: I stayed in the penthouse suite, which is a stand alone room on top of the roof. It was like having my own little apartment away from everyone. Beautiful terrace to sit on and a distant view of the Golden Gate Bridge. The morning I left the sun was shining, a humming bird flew past the window and I could hear the sea lions in the background, a perfect memory to take home. The staff was always helpful with directions to the places I wanted to visit. The hotel itself is so quaint, like stepping back in time.
review.positiveRemarks: The privacy that I had in the penthouse.
review.negativeRemarks: The refrigerator needed to be defrosted and I noticed hair on the shower curtain.
review.locationRemarks: I walked to fisherman's wharf, Chinatown and the italian neighborhood. Also one block away from the trolley. Excellent location and nice quiet street.

review.title: Great location, just a couple blocks from the pier
review.reviewText: Close to the pier and cable cars. Very quaint neighborhood , felt very safe. If you like shabby chic you will Love the decor! I wanted to take every piece of furniture home with me! The staff was very helpful and it just had a very homey comfortable feel. The rooms are very small so you had better Really like your travel partner, but very clean as we're the shared bathrooms. Overall I don't think you could find a better deal for the money in the city. Would definitely stay there again

review.title: Cutest hotel ever!
review.reviewText: The hotel is really cute and quaint and it is located in a great spot. There are a ton of restaurants nearby, it's about a 10 minute walk from Fisherman's Wharf, and a 15-20 minute walk to Crissy Field beach.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing :)
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: First time ever having to share a bathroom and shower, and it was much easier than I thought. I am a writer and there is so much for this place I can use in my novels
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to everything

review.title: Vintage Fun!
review.reviewText: I truly enjoyed my stay & it had a calm, relaxed vintage vibe. The staff was very nice & room was clean. No TV, but plenty of books. Plus, you spend most of the day out in S.F. Great location too. We can't wait to go back. Thank you San Remo!
review.positiveRemarks: Low key guest. Very quiet considering how close rooms are. Guest were very respectful.
review.locationRemarks: We walked from the BART station and all over! We did a tour bus and did not even need to rent a car.

review.title: A great place with lots of personality!
review.reviewText: The location of this quirky but clean hotel is fantastic! It is also one of the few affordable hotels in SF that you will feel safely staying in. The bed was very creaky but for the rest everything was great!

review.title: Great location and great price!
review.reviewText: Great location-close to the pier! Great price! Adorable, quaint hotel. I would definitely stay here again. Staff friendly and helpful. Very clean.

review.title: It was an adventure alright.
review.reviewText:
San Remo Hotel rocks. It has a colorful history (according to research it is haunted! Must have been one story up since I slept like a baby.), a great location (a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and the Cable Car Stop), interesting and different restroom/shower facilities (yes, they are not in the room but down the hall so bring a robe). The staff was accommodating and very polite. The rooms were quaint and clean. I loved every second of my stay.

The best thing was the price. I would recommend this hotel to any and all my friends who are willing and physically able to appreciate the adventure. I can't wait to return.

review.title: charming building but ho-hum room
review.reviewText: For the price it was OK. I was trying to economize. My single room was a bit small and bare. It was near the toilets and shower rooms, so people were going in and out of there a lot. That wasn't fortunate. On my last night the people next door came back to their room late and started talking. It sounded like they were IN my room. Thin walls. Even so, I would consider staying again. It's not sterile and cold like a motel. It's quirky and has character like a Bed and Breakfast. The other rooms seemed better located.
review.positiveRemarks: good location in North Beach. common areas have charm. love the plants in the hallways.
review.locationRemarks: near telegraph hill, which has gorgeous views. very pleasant to walk around the neighborhood, mostly residential with small businesses.

review.title: Check your bed for bed bugs.
review.reviewText:
We have stayed here several times in the past. We asked for the room with the sink and in the past were fine with what we were given, this time the room was even smaller, the main floor smelled and it just felt not very clean. I went upstairs to use the showers and bathroom which were much cleaner and in better condition.
We spent 3 nights there and the last day I noticed small spots all over my white bathrobe, I looked closely and some of them were moving. I got clean towels and wrapped myself up and went back to the room, trying no to touch anything, I got clothes out that had not been out of my suitcase, got dressed and showed the hotel personal.
They were nice enough and said they would look into it. No one came to check it out while we were there and no one did anything to accomodate us regarding the situation.
We wrapped everything up in plastic and left the hotel. I am now home and am not very happy that I need to leave everyting I took outside, wash everything I took - clean, worn or not to make sure there are no bugs. It grossed me out and made a lot of extra work for me. Nice way to end my vacation.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location - cable car pickup in little alley to the left when you walk out.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed bugs - not good. Whatever they put in the bathrooms that pumps out the smell - it is terrible.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Great staff, incredibly unique lodging experience.

review.title: Victorian style hotel with unique extras
review.reviewText:
If you book this hotel on-line, the price is good (budgeted hotel), Walk in could be much more. Hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful. Room is clean, but not very spacious. There are no ensuite bathroom. Some with ensuite sink. Each floor, there are public four bathroom, four public separate toilets. (all communal, and shared by both genders).
I still not get used to the communal toilets and bathroom. Good: guests are very respectful. Hotel staff allowed me for a late check out. 1.5 hr. from the posted time of 11am.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful. Free coffee and tea all day long. public massage chair every floor. There are always extra towel available
review.negativeRemarks: Could clean carpet or remove usual hotel smell.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, near fisherman wharf. Good public transportation to downtown (25 min. on bus). Pretty safe area to walk alone.

review.title: Cosy, friendly and great location
review.reviewText: Stayed for 4 week nights, would like to have stayed longer. San Remo has put a lot of effort into making the hotel feel like staying at a friend's home. The shared facilities are kept very clean and tidy (I guess a combined effort from patrons and staff, but it works well).

review.title: Great location in the city
review.reviewText: Had a great time. Walls a bit thin for crying babies and passionate lovers. We were however comfortable. The hotel has a very European feel.
review.positiveRemarks: The European feel

review.title: San Remo is tops!
review.reviewText: Extremely pleasant and comfortable room, very helpful front staff - overall a wonderful experience. Will definately stay there next time in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything

review.title: Gem of SF
review.reviewText: Whenever we visit SF, we always stay at the San Remo. It's like being in Europe -- interesting, funky in the best possible way. The hotel is family owned and staff are really friendly. The bathrooms are private and clean; we don't mind having to go down the hall. Because the hotel is very old fashioned, which is part of its charm, the rooms are small, and the beds seem pretty basic (no pillow tops here!) And best of all, the price cannot be beat. If you like staying at interesting places, rather than your basic chains, stay at the San Remo.
review.positiveRemarks: Atmosphere! And they have a jar of red vines at the desk!
review.negativeRemarks: The beds could be updated.
review.locationRemarks: North Beach is a great neighborhood, and the Italian restaurant below the hotel is one of the oldest and best in the city.

review.title: Great Retro Stay close to the Wharf
review.reviewText:
very quaint ! my wife and i enjoy these type of hotels
we have no problems sharing toilet rooms and showers-actually we never waited
or had anyone waiting on us
expect the room to be smaller than usual, and also no TV and no phone
why watch TV in SF ?

coffee in the am, books and magazines to read if you have time

the italian restaurant next to hotel was fabulous-great service great food
the bartenders were very talkative and the olympics were on during our visit

we will stay again next time we are in SF

Please go here - it's also historical !
review.positiveRemarks: close to wharf great restaurant next door coffee shop on the next block, also great breakfast place nearby also
review.locationRemarks: 3 blocks to wharf/cable cars 3 blocks to many bike rentals 3 blocks to Ghiradelli place, and Buena Vista bar ( irish coffee fame)

review.title: Quaint and historic but.....
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the European feel but it was too noisy and bed was too firm. Contributed to a sleepiness night.
review.positiveRemarks: Quaintness
review.negativeRemarks: Replace the hard beds with Simmons Beautyrest or similar
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, north beach

review.title: Nice quirky hotel
review.reviewText: Nice staff, interesting place to stay, probably most suited to couples with out children who do't mind a place a bit rough around the edges! What it lacks in facilities makes up for in character.

review.title: great hotel great location
review.reviewText: overall just a great hotel we were little concerned about the bathrooms but they were always kept clean, it wasn't awkward at all. the rooms were really small but that was expected. the staff were super friendly and really helpful. A charming place tucked away in a quiet residental area. The location is great, close to the cable cars, fisherman's warf and bus lines. We will definatly stay at the san reno again!!

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Hassle free, great parking near by. Very quiet, nice rustic feel.
review.positiveRemarks: That there wasn't a Television nor a Telephone in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: newer ceiling fans.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, Koit tower, Ghiradelli Square.

review.title: Cute, quirky hotel in a great spot!
review.reviewText: Really cute little hotel on a quiet street in a good neighborhood. Staff were friendly, everything was basic but clean, and the price can't be beat! Maybe not the spot to stay if you plan to spend a lot of time in your hotel room but a great base for exploring the city.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is a great location. Great for an entirely different experience than the normal chain hotel. Must be ok sharing a bathroom/shower down the hall.
review.positiveRemarks: Lots of character
review.locationRemarks: 4 blocks from Fisherman's wharf / Alcatraz landing

review.title: Think of it as a private hostel room!
review.reviewText:
Most reviewers are excited about the charm of the place. It is charming -- if you like charm, come on down. It's also cheap for being in a fantastic location. You get more than what you pay for... on the other hand, if you like having your own bathroom, if you like soundproofing (of any kind whatsoever!), if you like big comfy beds, then you won't be staying here. I like those things, but I like saving $$$ more.

The neighbourhood is actually quite quiet overall... though the hours up to and around midnight are occasionally punctuated by banging and clattering of some industrious sort in the adjacent alley. If you're a light sleeper, bring your earplugs. (Actually, the hotel provides them, apparently in lieu of chocolates on your pillow. By the way, the pillow is pretty spartan.)

Quirks: noisy mattresses (due to the plasticky mattress covers), the ability to identify by sound whether your neighbour is scratching themselves in a clockwise or counterclockwise manner.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location in North Beach. Clean. Inexpensive.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure if they can do much to improve comfort without moving to a newer (and probably relatively character-free) building.

review.title: Budget hotel in decent location
review.reviewText: Room was decent, but adjacent to shared bathrooms - toilets were leaky, so the noise was constant. Also, shared toilets are unisex, so cleanliness around the commode is an issue.
review.positiveRemarks: Inexpensive and located in a decent neighborhood.
review.negativeRemarks: Toilets should be segregated between men's and women's
review.locationRemarks: Relatively quiet neighborhood. Close to Trader Joe's, Safeway and restaurants. Conveniently located near muni lines.

review.title: Walking distance to Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: I had a late flight to SF and arrived to the hotel at 2am. I called the number on listed on the door front door and the concierge opened the door immediately. The room I stayed in was small, but just enough space to sleep and to keep my luggage. The building was built not too long after the earthquake of 1906, so the size was expected. A space heater was in my room, so the temperature was comfortable. There are two community showers, two sinks, and two private toilets. The bathrooms were clean. The walls are thin, those who woke up early were heard in the halls and in the bathrooms. Coffee was set out on the main floor around 830am. Friendly staff. I was given a key to open the front door to come and go as I please. The hotel is five blocks from Fisherman's Warf, Pier 39, Ferry to Alcatraz, and Boudin's Bakery, famous for their sour dough bread.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, charm, history.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is conveniently walking distance from Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: attentive and very friendly staff
review.reviewText:
Historical, cozy, and cute hotel. We're not usually into sharing a bath, however, the staff was constantly attending to this part of the hotel and they made us feel like it was our private bath; CLEAN. Close to North Beach/Warf so walking was easy. 5 stars from us.

John & Terri Rossi
Lake Oswego OR

review.title: Northtown stay

Hotel was like stepping back in time and was just great
Having the common bath and restrooms was better then i thought as they were very clean and never had any wait to use one and the hotel ws pretty full
Distance to muni was two easy blocks couple more blocks
One finds them self at pier 39 location was decent and your just far enouf away street noise outside at night was minimal

The down side was bed was super hard ok for me but other should be warned
Again i would stsy here again as all staff was top self location great and was relaxing stepping back in time for a night

review.negativeRemarks: Beds comfort

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Couldn't have asked for a better experience with the San Remo. Clean, closely located to many attractions, and above all, unique! I felt like I was transported back in time at this hotel. Must stay!

review.title: Since 1906... A lovely historically correct hotal.
review.reviewText: Comfortable, Great restaurant & Bar downstairs.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is convenient
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiardelli Square, The Cannery, Pier 39.

review.title: Fabulous location. Character ++
review.reviewText: Although going down the hall to the bathroom in the night or for a shower is less appealing, our stay in San Francisco was made all the more interesting by staying in this lovely, clean and intriguing hotel. I am so pleased that such opportunities exist. As others have said, the rooms are small, the beds are small, but reasonably comfortable. The bathrooms are very clean and there is even a towel warmer for the white pristine towels that are always available. Great staff especially the cleaners. A variety of coffee and other drinks (including snacks) were appreciated after our long days tramping through this wonderful and diverse city. This hotel is likely not a fit with everyone but for us, the cost, the uniqueness and the location made it a place we will definitely return to. Thank you for making our stay in San Francisco very memorable.

review.title: Good position, but the room is too tiny.
review.reviewText:
Every other day 8AM, there will be trash remove which generate TONS of noise, and you won't be able to sleep if your room is close to the alley.
No bathroom in the room, only public bathroom. Old facilities like water faucet keep dripping water, wooden floor generates lot of noise, etc.
No elevators, only narrow stairs.
The room is only about 120 sq. ft, NO KIDDING.
review.positiveRemarks: nice staff. They have a massage chair on each floor which is pretty nice.

review.title: North Beach Discovery
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay in this historic hotel in North Beach. We had a charming room overlooking the street which was great for watching the people going by on their way to celebrate the New Year.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.locationRemarks: Beach Blanket Babylon and fantastic restaurants! Enjoyed Rose Pistola and Mama's for breakfast.

review.title: Is like returning back in time
review.reviewText:
I love the history decoration , the antique furniture .
It's ideal for couples , it's silence and comfortable ,The staff clean all the time the shared bathrooms. You gotta tried.

review.title: Is like returning back in time
review.reviewText:
I love the history decoration , the antique furniture .
It's ideal for couples , it's silence and comfortable ,The staff clean all the time the shared bathrooms. You gotta tried.

review.negativeRemarks: The hours of front desk and the accessibility because it is necessary to use stairs.
review.locationRemarks: It is a very nice location really near of pier 39 and there is a lot of restaurants and public transportation in 5 minutes of walk.

review.title: Hotel with character near Fishermans Wharf
review.positiveRemarks: We enjoy hotels with history and a level of funky interest, and this hit the spot! Each room is different, shared bathrooms clean and handy.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf is walking distance, there is lots to explore in the vicinity.

review.title: Great Old Hotel with a Old World Hominess
review.reviewText:
Had stayed at another boutique hotel with shared bathrooms in the past. This was a great place to stay that was away from the downtown core but still close enough for a walk to the pier.

Great place to stay on a business trip if you want a different experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the Cable Car allowed me to ride both ways daily on a $28 1 week pass - very convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds are a little squeaky but I slept very well. Would have liked to see the Coffee and Tea service run from 6:00 am through late evening
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to the Pier, very close to Cable car stop. Away from downtown.

review.title: Amazing stay
review.reviewText: This place was great! Bear in mind it is a budget hotel but so worth it's money! Free wifi, water from fountain, clean basic rooms and friendly staff! They held our luggage for us!! They gave us tips and directions. The facilities were shared bath rooms and showers but they were always clean with fresh towels! There vendor machines and pay for washing machines and dryers. The location is great three blocks away from all the warf scenes! Can walk to Alcatraz pier etc can not fault this place ! It's old fashion but adds to the san fransicio style!!
review.positiveRemarks: It was a typical old San Fran style hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Everything is in close walking distance by three blocks

review.title: Lots of character
review.positiveRemarks: The place is old but has lots of character! free lollypops too!

review.title: A secret I hate to share!
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the San Remo several times and it is always a pleasure!
review.positiveRemarks: Not run of the mill, clean, staff is helpful, good location.
review.locationRemarks: Trader Joe's is close and Pat's has a good breakfast.

review.title: GREAT EXPERIENCE, but be aware of ............
review.reviewText: If you arrive after 10 pm, the hotel´s door will be locked and will be nobody there to open it for you. Have a cell phone available and charged to call at a number you will find posted on that door. Otherwise, that could be a HUGE bummer. Expedia people or the hotel staff NEVER said anything about this possible and really common situation. We arrived at around 10 pm and we were left there, outside the hotel, in the middle of a lonely street. My cell phone battery had died hours ago. Still, we were lucky. A Hispanic guy, really, really friendly, came out from a restaurant, after his work hours. He used his cell phone to call the hotel people. This helped us avoid what could have been an UGLY NIGHTMARE.
review.positiveRemarks: Its unique charm, good price, and unbeatable location.
review.negativeRemarks: See my comments below. Something else: please do not offer lollipops for breakfast. At least a cookie, or a cracker . . .
review.locationRemarks: Terrific LOCATION.

review.title: Great location and friendly staff
review.reviewText:
We loved the location but we were disappointed with our room. It was a bit of a shock and let down. Many of the other rooms looked much nicer than ours. Once we got over the shock we did like it and we would go back. We just weren't quite prepared for what we walked into. The bedding wasn't as clean as we were hoping to find. The staff was extremely helpful, pleasant and friendly.
We would recommend it to a friend but would prepare them.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the fact that we were so close to everything we wanted to see. The hotel had a lot of character and history.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms should be updated a little. It would be nice to have two chairs in each room. There's no place to put your suitcase or sit down.
review.locationRemarks: It is a fantastic location near everything we wanted to see. It is only a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street and two of the cable cars

review.title: Great Location:Great price
review.reviewText: We spent 4 nights at this hotel with a shared bath. We decided that we were too old to do shared bath again.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the location, the price, and the wonderfully helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: They could have coffee ready before 8am and have more hair dryers available for guests.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel was easy walking distance to to the wharf, Alcatraz dock, Coit tower, cable car, busstops, etc. The location is superior to Union Square.

review.title: Best deal in town, if you can do stairs.
review.reviewText: Nice, clean, affordable boutique hotel in a safe neighborhood one block from the cable car line. The shared bathrooms & showers were always clean and most rooms have a sink. One complaint was the hard bed but I was so tired every night that it didn't matter. Also, you must be able to do stairs since there is no elevator.

review.title: Cheap-European style hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great location near Fisherman's Wharf, and has a very European flavor to it. It's nice, as long as you don't come in expecting some large corporate style hotel with all the modern things. There's no TV in the room. The beds and furniture aren't the newest. The people at reception don't understand the concept of early check in (though they're nice enough about storing luggage in the manager's office while you go about town waiting to check in). The toilets and showers are shared. There isn't much in the way of sound-proofing, so you'll hear any conversations in neighboring rooms even if they're not raiding their voices. So why did I like it? It's got a certain charm to it. You can help yourself to coffee, ice water, even chocolate brownies at reception. There are interesting old photos, and other stuff all over the walls, even plants growing around the place. You feel you are staying in a place with character and rough around the edges charm. And of course it's cheaper than anything else you're likely to find in such a good location. They left us an offer in our room on the day before departure: $50 for another night if we wanted it. We couldn't stay, but would have considered it under other circumstances. The wireless internet connection is free for everyone (so you don't need an expedia coupon for it), and mostly it's sufficient, except in the mid-evening when too many people are trying to use it. Other times we could watch our IPAD Netflix without hitch.
review.positiveRemarks: Funky old world charm.
review.negativeRemarks: Should let guests check in early when there are clearly lots of empty rooms available.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to Fishermans Wharf and everything in the area. Cable cars, ferries, bike rental, restaurants, etc.

review.title: Great hotel for the price in good location
Good value for the price
review.reviewText: I came for a business trip provided by RentBin.ca. Compared to the other hotels, this one was much less expensive and provided sufficient essentials such as Internet, cleanliness. For the price, this hotel is much less expensive and gave quality service. I would stay here again.

review.title: love that hotel . great location .
review.reviewText: well it was great , a step back in time . clean and a warm welcome to San Francisco . many thanks
review.positiveRemarks: it had real old school character
review.negativeRemarks: no , don't touch it
review.locationRemarks: it was all near to the hotel , just a short walk

review.title: Perfect place to stay
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. It had a great location with plenty of wonderful restaurants close by and easy access to public transport. Never had a wait for the shared bath. Plenty of warm towels provided. Staff was wonderful. My only complaint was the air fresheners made me sneeze.

review.title: Great Location, short walk to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: San Remo is a unique San Francisco experience. If you're happy to share the washrooms and showers, both of which are kept clean, then it's a great place to stay. It's quaint, quirky and comfortable. The staff are friendly and can help suggest tourist attractions and organise taxis and shuttles. I struggled without a TV as I sometimes enjoy sitting back in a hotel room and chilling out, however, I was out so often it proved manageable. I recommend the San Remo Hotel, it's a real San Fran experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great, close to Fisherman's Wharf. Friendly Staff. Coffee, tea and tourist brochures offered in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: TV's in rooms, but it's not really necessary.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 has great tourist shops, restaurants and of course the Sea Lions are great. Cha Cha Cha's on Haight Street. Do it!

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to write a comment. We love to hear back from our guests. If you want a central place with affordable rates, we are your hotel.

Come back soon!

review.title: Nice boutique hotel, EXCELLENT location
review.reviewText: Hotel had a nice historic feel. Great location, just a few blocks away from fisherman's warf. We walked everywhere. Wifi and computer/printer access. Friendly staff. Highly recommended!

review.title: There's a reason they give complimentary earplugs!
review.reviewText: Don't get an "inside room". Very hot and noisy. The penthouse is great, though.

review.title: No frills but frilly curtains
review.reviewText: Hotel seems more like a cross between a hostel and going to stay at Grandma's Antique Shop. Rooms are tiny and there seem to be a lot of rooms per bathroom. However, the bed was v comfortable and firm and everything was super clean. Fresh towels available and constantly replenished on rails by bathrooms, which were cleaned several times a day by smiley staff, and waiting for bathroom was never really an issue, so initial concerns vanished quickly. The location is great, close to Fisherman's Wharf, but back from the seedier touristy bit and by a Trader Joe's and Ralph's market. Cablecar car is close too. Excellent value for money as all nearby hotels are 3 or 4 times the price. Front desk staff extremely helpful. I would recommend avoiding a room near the bathrooms, as you might get disturbed by late night visits and flushing! We had a great time here, but I am not sure I would want to stop here first, if I had come off a long flight, unless you are a heavy sleeper. It's not really noisy, it's just that that the rooms are packed close together and you are very aware of other guests' movements up and down the corridors. I must say though, I am usually a bit squeamish about shared bathrooms, but the staff really do a good job of keeping them clean and the paper seat covers and mats are appreciated. We had good cafe recommendations from the front desk for our breakfast, but there is coffee and tea available during the day in the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Price and location mainly. The staff were very helpful and informative
review.negativeRemarks: Please change that awful flowery carpet in the main areas!
review.locationRemarks: Nice quiet neighborhood, though very close to Fisherman's Wharf and public transport. It is easy to get around from here.

review.title: Lovely quirky hotel close to all amenities
review.reviewText: Had a really lovely stay, hotel staff really helpful, room clean and shared bathroom facilities were really clean whatever time of day we used them - we would not hesitate to stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was rally close to Fishermans wharf and also tram and cable car stops
review.negativeRemarks: A lift would be great as we had a lot of luggage.

review.title: Great little place to stay
review.reviewText: Super cute little hotel at a very good price! My daughter and I stayed here for a 3 day stop between flights. The hotel is very clean and quaint. I was a little concerned that the bathrooms were down the hall but shouldn't have worried. There was never a line up for showers and we were there during the America's Cup finals..a very busy time in San Francisco. At the check in desk is a table with fresh coffee, tea, cider and hot chocolate. There is a massage chair on each of two floors. This is all free of charge for guests. The staff were helpful and kind. I really can't say enough! Will stay here again next time I'm in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel has an old world feel about it. The halls are winding and narrow with antiques and plants. Every room is charming and different.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing I can think of, that could have been improved, was that the beds were a little hard.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to Starbucks, Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, Lombard St., restaurants. Easy walk to anything you want to see.

review.title: San Remo
review.reviewText: The shared showers and toilets aren't a deal-breaker but they are a bit annoying once the novelty wears off.
review.positiveRemarks: Quirky and very individual - also very reasonably priced.
review.locationRemarks: Good location in North Beach.

review.title: Fantastic old world hotel
review.reviewText: I know many people hated this hotel, but for the price and location it is unbeatable value. Staying in it took you back to Victorian times, having no on suite meant you had to interact with people and say Good Morning when queuing for the showers. It is things like these that make a holiday special. The décor is on par with the period and sets it off perfectly. Stay here for something different that is not your usual mass-produced hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: the general quirkiness of the place and the feeling that you had just stepped back one hundred years in time
review.negativeRemarks: Don't change it apart from leaving the water cooler out overnight as the cold drinking water would have been much appreciated on warm evenings
review.locationRemarks: What can't you do within walking distance of this hotel? The wharves, Columbus street and restaurants, Chinatown and fantastic public transport

review.title: A unique quant hotel
review.reviewText:
Loved our time at the San Remo, the fresh
Lemon ice water and coffee/tea selection
Was also refreshing. The rooms were so cute.
Could of had newer beds/pillows but was comfortable.
Had extras that regular hotels don't have,
Like laundry, cute old bath tub, pay phone,
Massage chairs, lots of infor and maps for
Things to do and see. The staff were fantastic.
BUT...you have to be ok with sharing the bathroom
Facility.
Thanks for everything
review.positiveRemarks: Unique, the lemon water, the helpful staff The location was PERFECT!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Newer bedding/ beds Keep the lemon water there after 10( all night)
review.locationRemarks: It is within walking distance to almost Everything! It was great!

review.title: A great value find in a fabulous location
review.reviewText:
This is a quirky little place - rooms are small but comfortable and furnished individually. Downside is shared bathroom but very clean and fine fior a couple of days and so much better than paying a fortune for the soulless hotel chains just down the road.
Staff were really helpful too and free tea and coffee in the lobby was a bonus
We loved the character of this place - tons of interesting information about the hotel"s history and the people who have made it what it is today. Nice touches like old fashioned pull chain toilets and Victorian style basins.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is excellent - just a couple of blocks from Fishermans Wharf and close to the cable car.
review.locationRemarks: Top tip - breakfast at Pat"s cafe just around the corner is excellent - great chilled atmosphere .

review.title: Hotel and room.
review.reviewText:
The room was clean and tidy and the bed was comfortable, it was a bit of a let down that there was no 'en suite' but, in my experience, for my budget rooms with 'en suite' are quite rare. I would have liked a room with a view that looked out onto a 'view' but again this was a minor issue as we only used the room as a place to sleep and did not spend that much tiome in it.
The location was very good, close to where I wanted to be and within walking distance of the main attractions of the area, but it was als close to a good transport link that one could access to 'get across town'.
Quite at night, which meant that we got a good nights sleep, which I always find helpful and there were drinks available for guests. The staff were friendly and helpful, which is always a bonus.
Overall; an enjoyable stay at a nice, affordable hotel, in a quite street, there was a restraunt attached, but I never accessed this, but it looked popular, with a good crowd inside.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor, history, (of the hotel), quite, availability of hot drinks.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, close to Fisherman's Wharf and the Cable Car. One could walk to many other tourist attractions without too much effort.

review.title: Great location, affordable room.
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco for less than 24 hours and needed an affordable, convenient hotel for the night. Because we were only around for a short time, the shared bathrooms didn't bother us a bit, and the room was good for the price. If you need a glamorous place to stay, or are traveling with a family, I would look elsewhere, but for us it was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Good price and great location.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and public transportation.

review.title: Great place For a San Fran Stay.
review.reviewText:
Don't let the shared bathroom and toilets freak you out and not make you stay....it's a great place to stay for visiting San Francisco. The location is great and the staff couldn't do enough for you. The rooms are not the most comfortable I've stayed in but it is what it is, an old style hotel. I'd probably describe it as a posh hostel....but one well worth staying in. great value for money.
They have the added bonus of Pat's Cafe just around the corner. A great breakfast to set you up for the days sightseeing.

review.title: "Ye olde hotelle"
review.reviewText: a nifty vintage style, definitely a nice change from typical hotels. the rooms weren't the most inviting or spacious, and a bit drafty. im not a fan of the san Francisco breeze. otherwise I enjoyed my stay and slept quite well leaving me feeling refreshed. the staff was quite helpful but seemed slightly impatient with my various questions. ill admit can be a bit difficult with my inquisitive nature, however. the restaurant that is attached to the hotel was quite nice and has a bar that stays open somewhat late. overall an enjoyable experience.
review.locationRemarks: right next to fishermans wharf and various other shops.

review.title: Just right
review.reviewText: Nice little hotel in a great part of town...as long as you don't mind communal showers, no TV and some noise at night....now I know why they offer ear plugs! But was not really that bad. If you want to stay a day or so in the Pier 39 area and just need a place to lay your head at the end of a long day, this hotel works well.

review.title: I'll always stay here when I stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights and had our visit already planned, though had we not, the staff was happily available for suggestion on what to do and see. We love non corporate hotels, restaurants, etc. and this place was like staying at a friends giant house. Great lighting and lots of house plants on both levels. An extremely enjoyable stay. Thanks so much!
review.positiveRemarks: For those of you who don't like to drive in the city please see below...
review.locationRemarks: For an extra $18 (per 24 hrs including tax) you can park your car in a second floor guarded lot just a block or so away from the hotel. Can't be beat.

review.title: Quick trip to San Fran
review.reviewText: Quaint place tight on space. Beds were creaky and not overly comfy but good enough. Location was fantastic. Place was clean. Shared shower and bathroom facilities was a bit inconvenient but okay for a few days given the location and service.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and off the tourist strip
review.negativeRemarks: Building noise and garbage truck noise early in morning but ear plugs helped.
review.locationRemarks: Great access to cable cars, Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39 and downtown via bus etc. neighborhood felt safe.

review.title: Value in downtown
review.reviewText: Staff helpful. No coffee or water until 8am. Good location though.
review.positiveRemarks: Location; price
review.negativeRemarks: In a hotel there should be staff available in morning . When you travel, you are sightseeing or traveling to different locations or going to airport .

review.title: Our favorite place in SF
review.reviewText: Love staying here; like stepping back in time, with all conveniences. Location, friendly & accomodating staff, immaculately clean, cozy rooms with thoughtful details. Parking easy, great restaurant downstairs and coffeehouse at corner.

review.title: A very special hotel
review.reviewText:
This is a special palace to stay. If you are looking for something personal and not a homogeneous chain hotel then I highly recommend. Staff are very helpful and the rooms have great character. There are many personal touches and many interesting books and art works to browse. It is in a good location near north beach and within walking distance of the wharf which is actually ver touristy and so I would avoid if you are into more cultural pursuits. North beach area is walking distance and is wonderful.
Don't be out off by shared bathrooms, they are clean and very nicely decorated.
I really recommend this place for its charm and uniqueness.
Enjoy!
review.positiveRemarks: Decor, books, attention to detail, history and location.
review.negativeRemarks: Having to lift heavy luggage up the stairs, there's no lift!
review.locationRemarks: The location is 5 mins from fisherman wharf but I would avoid this as it is very commercial. Although further along the bay to the west it is lovely.

review.title: Well located in North Beach
review.reviewText: I always look for historic boutiques to stay in, and this one did not disappoint. The shared bathrooms were very nice and I never had to wait to access the water closet or the shower. I especially enjoyed the huge clawfooted tub on the 3rd floor. It is above the country's oldest Italian restaurant, though I never did manage to get a meal or a drink there. The San Remo is in Little Italy, a few short blocks away from the Muni bus system and trolley cars, and within walking distance of the Wharf and Ghirardeli Square, for those of you who do a lot of walking. There is also a Trader Joes right around the corner, and a Safeway a couple of blocks beyond that. I enjoyed my stay there very much and would recommend it to anyone looking for a 'bed outside of the box". I might check out the Penthouse suite the next time I visit the city.
review.positiveRemarks: It's location, and that it was very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff did not seem to be knowledgeable about the things I wanted to see, but my choices are usually pretty esoteric and I found them on my own.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby attractions include Lombard Street, Ghirardelli Square, and Fisherman's Wharf. Be sure to hop onto the F-Line vintage street cars on the pier.

review.title: Classic Hotel near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: WE looked for a hotel in the city that would take pets - this one did. But it was a challenge driving thru the streets of SF - our GPS went out because of the high buildings right in the middle of downtown. We had to circle around because the street we were looking for had construction - don't they all! The rooms are small - "cozy" , but we had a corner room and had good cross ventilation. Your neighbors are very close, but polite. The bathroom is down the hall, but very clean. We loved being within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and had a good stroll after dinner. It's not for everyone, but if you don't mind "historic" and "classic" then this is a good one. We will probably go back.

review.title: Pleasant
review.reviewText:
While the San Remo is not for everyone, it is a great bargain for those who do not need the amenities found at expensive hotels and do not mind communal showers and toilets.

The room I had was clean and very neat. The bed was great to sleep on and the supplying of ear plugs was appreciated. The overhead fan was great also.

The biggest draw for me was the nearness of the wharf area and the bay. While the wharf area can be really awful during prime time, I found getting up early (early was before 7:00 AM) and walking the wharf and piers was great.
review.positiveRemarks: As I wrote above, being close to the Bay was the best thing.

review.title: Very nice hotel with an affordable price.
review.reviewText: This hotel is very close to the Fisherman's Wharf (just 5 min). Compared to other hotel, the prices are very good. The hotel is also designed so good and you will feel like you are in early 1900s. The crew there are also so nice people and help you on any subject.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, location and cleanness are combines in this hotel.

review.title: Very basic, but cheap and cheerful.
review.reviewText: Great location, excellent value but a very basic set up. No phones or TVs and very small rooms, but if you're on a budget and want something cheap and cheerful you won't be disappointed. Not great for couples though, as the walls are PAPER THIN. Also not great for anyone with mobility issues as there are lots of stairs to pull your luggage up. However if you're traveling with friends or on your own it's not a bad option, especially as it is half the price or less of the adjoining hotels. I decided to stay an extra day, which they only charged me $50 for. Pretty happy with that!
review.positiveRemarks: Price, location
review.negativeRemarks: Shared bathrooms, limited privacy

review.title: Great little piece of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Great hotel in awesome location. Don't expect lifts and tv type comfort but great place to stay if wanting cleAn room, helpful staff and great location.

review.title: Great hotel for the right person.
review.reviewText: I loved this place, but your needs/desires may differ from mine. It reminds me of hotels in rural Germany in the 50's and 60's. Safe neighborhood, no bedbugs, spotless, virtually unremodeled since its construction right after the earthquake in 1906 (to house crab fishermen.) Remember, at the time, bedroom pretty much = bed + room... Mine also had a pair of nightstands with reading lamps, a bureau with mirrors, a wardrobe, and a chair; that's it. Electricity updated and to code; plenty of outlets. Now for the historic part. The sink was down the hall, complete with standard plus lighted shaving mirrors, etc. The shower cabins and hamper for used towels were also down the hall, so you may wish to pack bathrobe + slippers. Next to the shower cabins in the hall were the presumably original toilets, connected by a handsome brass pipe to the water tank enclosed in a lovely wooden encasement, above your head. Flush, of course, is triggered by pull chain. If you come in late, don't worry about waking the night desk clerk; there isn't one. You're given two keys when you register, the key to the room, and the key to the front door of the hotel, so just let yourself in. There's free (good) coffee in the morning, and a most helpful staff. This is not a hostel; you have your own, lockable room. But it's pretty much a hotel in a time capsule. The entries the comment book at the desk before me were in French and Italian, and they loved it too (also didn't expect the Ritz.)
review.positiveRemarks: True old SF ambiance, with no more amenities than I wanted/needed. My next hotel in SF charged hefty "administrative fee" = resort fee sans a resort.
review.negativeRemarks: Earlier in the evening, the absence of any soundproofing may at times become apparent, depending on the manners/activities of the guests.
review.locationRemarks: A few blocks south of Fisherman's Wharf; a short walk to Gary Danko's, where dinner for 1 will cost more than your hotel room (but it'll be worth it)

review.title: The best location
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel, but it's definitely not for everyone. It walking distance to fisherman's wharf, lots of great restaurants and an easy cable car ride to china town and downtown. The front desk is more than willing to help out and answer any questions for you. The rooms are small though and sharing a bathroom and walking to the shower might be a problem for some but we had no problems with that
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were small
review.locationRemarks: Location was PERFECT

review.title: charming sf hotel
review.reviewText: this charming victorian style pensionne is a great spot to stay in san francisco. inside is full of plants and historical photos and objects. you can borrow a book or relax on a massage chair. the rooms are basic and clean (no tvs, minibars or ice machines). shared bathrooms are great. staff is very helpful. seems to attract european clientele. north beach is a great neighbourhood.
review.positiveRemarks: charming decor, good location, nice clean showers

review.title: Great hotel for singles and young couples.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very cozy, ideal for young couples who don't mind sharing bathrooms and showers. The location is great, central and quiet area. I would definitely go back.
