photos.caption: View out of bath tub/shower window

review.title: Romantic, quaint, feels like you're in Italy!
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff, cozy rooms, was a bit worried about not having a bathroom in our room but it worked out great!! They were very clean, bathrooms were never full so still seemed private. Loved not having TVs in the room. Would recommend to students, couples of any age. Very romantic and charming. Great location, walking distance to fishermans warf, the beach, cable cars, north beach restaurants! Can't wait to go back.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, building, decor, location, affordable price
review.negativeRemarks: Mattress on the bed was a bit uncomfortable
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location for the price, walking distance to public transportation, the warf, the beach, restaurants, beautiful views out if bedrooms!

review.title: Charming and affordable
review.reviewText: This is a charming, clean and interesting historical hotel in a great location with very helpful staff. It is a great bargain for those who don't require much luxury. Short walk to great restaurants and close to attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: Restaurant and bar downstairs and Pat's for breakfast around the corner through a charming alley.
review.negativeRemarks: Short wait for communal restroom - not bad.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent!

review.title: Brilliant staff
review.reviewText:
Lovely unique hotel. Staff are outstanding and so helpful. They even produced bolt croppers at 10 in the evening when my padlock got stuck on my suitcase.
Main issue is the size of the rooms which are really small, barely room to move round each other. It was quite a contrast from the other hotels we stayed at in other cities. However it didn't matter too much as we didn't spend too much time in them.
Other comment is that don't expect to sleep in past 7 or 8 as all the guests are early risers and the cleaners start hoovering at 8. I am a light sleeper and the walls were thin so I was woken throughout the night by people using bathroom or leaving for airport in early morning.
However I would recommend the hotel if just for a few days as the above issues would not be too much of a problem. Location is also brilliant.

review.title: Fantastic location for sightseeing
review.reviewText: I was travelling alone and doing sightseeing for just 3 days. I found the location of the hotel was fantastic as it is very close to Fisherman's wharf and had two grocery stores nearby. The hotel itself is charming, but don't stay here if you want all the mod cons. The shared showers and toilets were spotlessly clean and the water pressure was great with plenty of hot water. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel provides ear plugs in the rooms - this gives an indication of how thin the walls are - but if you are lucky you will have quiet neighbours. I would stay here again because it was cheap and cheerful and has lots of history in its walls.
review.positiveRemarks: Fantastic showers
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy neighbours
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location for sightseeing

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: Great location, however, the rooms are small and very noisy. I'm glad we booked the room during their spring sale time. I would hate to pay full price. We had a room with window facing to hallway- never stay in this kind of room! It was very small and hot and they don't have an AC. The walls and ceilings are very thin, therefore, you HAVE to sleep with earplugs in. The cleaning service wasn't great- they didn't replace soap and didn't vacuum floor, for example. In addition, plastic cover over a mattress - didn't add any relax to our sleep. Overall, the unique design was cute and charming, but I would never stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: noise, very small room

review.title: Quirky hotel for a quirky town
review.reviewText: The San Remo is ideally located between Fisherman's Wharf and downtown, close to the termini for cable cars and streetcars. When we arrived we got a free upgrade from the staff member at reception, whom I cannot praise highly enough for his friendliness and attitude. The real attraction is the quirky nature of this hotel which is a window on the past. Do be prepared for small rooms however.

review.title: Great Time at San Remo Hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was above and beyond our expectations. The room was uniquely furnished and the hallways were full of interesting pieces. Even the bathroom had a clawfoot tub and a pull chain toilet - it was all very authentic! There was always fresh coffee and lemon water available by the front desk which was a nice added touch. Plus the staff were quite helpful and very pleasant. The location was perfect for exploring north beach, pier 39, fishermans warf, little italy, china town, the financial district, lombard street, alcatraz etc.. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!
review.positiveRemarks:
The authentic decor
Good wifi
Very clean
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Old hotel with modern amenities missing
review.reviewText: Extremely tiny room with a double bed jammed into one corner; no sink or toilet; no parking in a densely populated neighborhood. In and out parking at a public garage 3 blocks away for $16 per day.

review.title: Charming low-cost old hotel
review.reviewText: A quaint and charming old hotel, well-maintained. Small rooms, but clean and comfortable. Looks like much of the furniture is the original. Free coffee in the hallway. Great location -- walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, easy access to Chinatown, direct busline to BART downtown. I rented a bike at Blazzing Saddles nearby and biked through the Presidio and across Golden Gate Bridge. Fantastic views on the bike ride.
review.positiveRemarks: charming, low rates
review.negativeRemarks: some noise through the walls
review.locationRemarks: wonderful location near Fisherman's Wharf and Presidio and Chinatown

review.title: A real adventure
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel because it was the only hotel I could find under $100. I wouldn't even call it a hotel really; I'd call it more like a hostel. To me a tv and a bathroom are basic necessities. Fantastic coffee.

review.title: Near the wharf
review.reviewText: I had stayed in this hotel before and gladly returned for a three-day stay. Very conveniently located near the wharf but far enough not to be bothered.

review.title: Great hotel for budget conscious travelers.
review.reviewText: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the San Remo Hotel although we admit it's not for everyone. The San Remo is an old still hotel in the fashion of a boarding house. The rooms are small, and the baths are shared with other guests but we found neither of these issues to be a problem. After all we didn't come to San Francisco to hang out in our hotel room. We would recommend the San Remo to budget conscious travelers that are looking for an affordable place to stay, but would prefer someplace that's a step up from a hostel.
review.positiveRemarks: Affordable and had an old style charm
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms and slow internet
review.locationRemarks: Great base location for exploring north San Francisco especially the Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: lovely hotel
review.reviewText:
Very unique and quaint hotel! Loved the way the front desk, hallways and rooms looked - very vintage and old SF like. We had a sink in the bedroom and also used the shared bathroom which was really clean. Walking distance to the wharf, trader joe's and all that.
Best part about this hotel is the staff - they are chilled, laid back and not "corporatey". Major hotel chain staff kinda feels like they are in a hurry but try to be nice. These folks here are sincerely nice and even though were already checked out, let us leave to our luggage so we can site see at the Wharf.

We will definitely stay here again :)
review.positiveRemarks: lovely feeling, everything feels vintage here
review.negativeRemarks: nothing, you just have to understand that these rooms are smaller
review.locationRemarks: close to everything in the wharf area

review.title: best for the younger and/or more agile
review.reviewText: It's in a great area between north beach and fisherman's wharf and only one block from the cable car line. Wonderful restaurants abound. The hotel rooms are small but comfortable and the ambiance is friendly and similar to a hostel. We found it very enjoyable for our one night stay.

review.title: An antidote for large chain hotels
review.reviewText:
I enjoyed the San Remo as an antidote to chain hotels that are constantly trying to sell customers more---there is no bottled water for sale in the room, no over-priced mini-bar, no charge for internet access. The hotel decor offers a nostalgic charm that hearkens back to its 1906 origins. And I thought the locations was great, since it's near Fisherman's Wharf and just a block from the Powell and Mason cable car line. I was attending a conference at Moscone Center, on the other end of the cable car line, and I appreciated the excuse to take the cable car across the city. And the room rate was not too hard on my professional travel budget.

My room was tiny---just enough space for a double bed, with a bit of room to move around the bed. I have a penchant for quirky hotels with small rooms, and I was unperturbed by this. No television, but I never watch TV when I'm traveling on my own. I was happy that I had enough space to pull a chair up to the bedside table and work on my laptop.

The San Remo does have some downsides. It does not have en suite bathrooms. I worried that I would find myself in competition with other guests for the showers in the morning, but as it happened I never had a problem. The front desk is only open from 8 am to 10 pm, so I barely crossed paths with the desk staff. And they didn't have enough irons the first night I was there. (They implied that they'd been blind-sided by my fellow conference goers.)

review.title: Two thumbs up
review.reviewText: It has character. Not the typical boring room you get at every major chain hotel. Plus its a bit cheaper which is nice. Good location.

review.title: Inexpensive hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very cramped conditions, shared restrooms. some with sink. but overall clean and apparently well-managed. Close to the end of one of the Cable Car lines and close to Fisherman/s Wharf.

review.title: Rooms and bathroom spaces not designed for comfort
review.reviewText:
I am usually very tolerant of shortcomings in hotels. My basic philosophy is that a hotel is just a place to sleep when I am traveling, and it's very unusual for me to complain about a hotel. However I was so disappointed with the San Remo that I wanted to warn other future travelers of what they might expect.

I was disappointed with the quality of my room and with the shared bathroom facilities. My bedroom was small and did not have an exterior window. There was an interior window, but it faced onto the common hallway. Also, the bathroom facilities were very small and inconvenient.

On my floor there were two very small rooms each with a toilet. The two little toilet rooms were barely big enough to turn around in.

The two showers were also each in small separate rooms, (approx. 16 sq ft each), with plastic shower curtains hung diagonally in each shower room to form a very small triangular shower space in one half of the little shower room and another small triangular space where you could hang your close on hooks while showering.

There was also a sink outside in the hall near the bathroom and toilet rooms.

I definitely will never be going back to this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel did have nice old furniture.
review.negativeRemarks: Room and bathroom layout was cramped and uncomfortable.

review.title: Best deal on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
The San Remo is a nice hotel that throws you back into the early 20th century in a good way. The hotel is restored and has a lot of cool history behind it. The rooms are simple and small, but clean and comfortable. What this hotel has is an excellent price for the location. Trader Joe's, Safeway, and the Fisherman's Wharf are a two minute walk away. I would recommend it to anyone that wants to experience the city rather than a hotel room with bells and whistles. I will be staying there again next time I'm there.

By the way, they offered us a half off deal to stay a second night if we preferred. Too bad we had to head home.
review.positiveRemarks: LOCATION IS EXCELLENT FOR THE PRICE!
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were relatively small but acceptable.

review.reviewText: Quaint, clean, fun, interesting, true to its early SF history. Very safe neighborhood, excellent location, excellent price. I walked to the Embarcadero, Coit Tower, Chinatown, Fishermans Wharf ... all very accessible from the San Remo!

review.title: I'll be back! :)
review.reviewText:
First time in a hotel without a bathroom, inroom.
The facilities were very clean with heated towels even!
Myself and wife both took our showers at night..haha...0200,
we had the whole place to ourselves.
In the AM, as expected, all facilities were being used.
The extra 10.00 for a sink, inroom was worthit as you have drinking water and a quick clean-up and toothbrushing.
Easy walking distance to the bay/wharfs and to the Saloon, a great blues bar!
Next time to Frisco, this will be the 1st place I look for.
